_header: Alas mine eye why dost thou bringe
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 102.
Title(s): ‘Why art thow thus my mortall foe’
_description: ‘Why art thow thus my mortall foe’ — one quatrain

BodAsh176.Transcription:
Alas myne eye whye doest thou bringeallwayes my hart in payne and
                    woeSythe thowe me rulest in everye thingwhye art thou thus my mortall
                    foe

Wagner,  B. M. 
             “New Songs of the Reign of Henry VIII.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         50 (1935): 452-55: 453.
Seaton,  Ethel. 
             Sir Richard Roos, c. 1410-1482: Lancastrian Poet.
         London: R. Hart-Davis, 1961: 179.
